text:
I was getting the error "httpd: bad user name nobody". The user/group specified during 
compile, and in the configuraion file was "www". I even tried passing the "User" directive 
to httpd at the comand line. Creating the user "nobody" allowed httpd to boot, and child 
processes were passed to the user "www" correctly.

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
What were the User/Group in httpd.conf set to?

It is a little confusing figuring out exactly what bug you are reporting.

creator: jim@apache.org
text:
When compiled, Apache stores away the default setting of DEFAULT_USER, which is
'nobody'. When Apache first starts up, it bootstraps its configuration using
that setting. If you need to change that, you will need to recompile with
something like :

   CFLAGS="-DDEFAULT_USER=web"

to change the compile-time setting.
